data.title: Push Square - PS5, PSVR2 News & Reviews 24/7
data.meta_description: The world's most popular PlayStation News & Reviews website, covering everything PS5 and PSVR2 along with retro/classic gaming from PlayStation's history.
data.text:
News More Tales Announcements Incoming for Series' 30th Anniversary

More Tales to tell

Earlier this week, Bandai Namco revealed Tales of Graces f Remastered. But what fans may not realise is that this was actually just one of multiple announcements that the publisher has planned, in celebration of the series' 30th anniversary. Officially, Tales turns 30 in December, so it sounds like we might be getting a staggered...

Bandai Namco

Tales

News Harry Potter: Quidditch Champions' Snitch Has Been Dramatically Nerfed on PS5, PS4

You Snitch

As a competitive sport, Quidditch is broken. Those of you who’ve read the Harry Potter novels will know that catching the elusive, winged ball will earn the Seeker’s associated team 150 points and conclude the match. This effectively renders everything else occurring within the arena irrelevant, and while the books do a good job of...

Warner Bros

PS5

PS4

Harry Potter

Quidditch Champions

Mini Review Shadow of the Ninja Reborn (PS5) - Lovingly Restored Classic Shinobi Action

Back to the future

Shadow of the Ninja Reborn brings the classic Natsume side-scrolling ninja action game to modern audiences, and it remains a worthy experience even some 33 years later. It demands the level of challenge that games released in the 90s often do, but if you're okay with that, it looks better than it ever did and offers an enjoyable...

Reviews

News PS4 Players Won't Have to Wait Long for Lollipop Chainsaw RePOP

Can't stop thinking about the Nayeon song

Lollipop Chainsaw RePOP, the remastered version of Grasshopper’s kitsch character action, will launch first on PS5, from 12th September. However, if you’re yet to upgrade to Sony’s new-gen system, you won’t have to wait long for a PS4 version: it’s due out in November digitally. There’ll be no...

News Astro Bot 2 Hinted at in PS5 Platinum Trophy Description

"See you in Astro's next adventure!"

Ahead of its PS5 release next week, the Trophy list for Astro Bot has been posted to Exophase, and what is noteworthy is the Platinum Trophy description: "Earned all Trophies. Well done and see you in Astro's next adventure!" So, will Astro Bot 2 be out before the end of the PS5 generation? That's a question to...

News Green Ranger Tommy Oliver Joins the Roster of Power Rangers: Rita's Rewind on PS5, PS4

Available to wishlist on PS Store

Green Ranger Tommy Oliver has [Update: apparently not] divided Power Rangers fans for decades, but there was next to no chance he’d be absent from upcoming PS5 and PS4 throwback brawler Mighty Morphin’ Power Rangers: Rita’s Rewind. You’ll actually unlock the character upon completing the campaign, so he’s...

News Black Myth: Wukong Patch 1.0.8 Promises Loads of Fixes on PS5, But No Performance Boosts

Paint it black

The first post-launch update for Black Myth: Wukong is available to download now on PS5. Patch 1.0.8 weighs in at a reasonable 1.1GB, but players hoping for improvements to technical performance will likely be left disappointed. The update focuses on fixes for a range of more specific issues, many of which are related to gameplay...

Game Science

Black Myth: Wukong

News The Witcher 4 Close to Full Production, Next Cyberpunk Progressing as Planned

Slow your role

It's been a good few months since we last heard from CD Projekt, but it sounds like the company's still got everything under control. As has been widely reported, it currently has two separate teams working on the next game in The Witcher series (commonly referred to as The Witcher 4), and the sequel to Cyberpunk 2077. The Witcher 4...

The Witcher

News Clock Tower: Rewind Lands Halloween Launch in Asia, No Western Release Date Yet

Tick tock

Clock Tower: Rewind, the revamped release of Sunsoft's beloved horror classic, now has a release date — but only in Japan and Asia so far. The adventure game will very aptly make its Eastern debut on 31st October 2024, when it'll be available both digitally (PS5 and PS4) and physically (on PS5). Currently, there's no word on the game's...

WayForward

PS4

Clock Tower

News Not Much Space for Dino Crisis After Monster Hunter Success, Creator Says

Mikami surprised that fans want another game

Dino Crisis creator Shinji Mikami has argued there's not a "whole lot of space" left for the series to occupy following the huge success of the Monster Hunter franchise. Despite the pretty clear differences between the two, Mikami feels that the "awesomeness of dinosaurs and the stuff you can do with"...

Capcom

Rumour PS5 Pro Design Seemingly Leaked

Reveal in the first half of September

Former PS Plus leaker turned general insider Billbil-kun has today shared a sketch of what they believe Sony's rumoured PS5 Pro console will look like, having seen "a visual of the front of the final packaging box". They state the upgraded box is indeed called the PS5 Pro, and the official reveal is expected to...

Sony

News Vampire Survivors Has a Whopping 221 Trophies to Collect on PS5, PS4

Getting them all simply a matter of survival

Vampire Survivors launches on PS5 and PS4 today, and it's bringing with it probably one of the largest, if not the largest, collection of Trophies for a single game. The smash hit indie title arrives on PlayStation with a list totalling 221, including the precious Platinum. It becomes a little easier to...

News Fill the Advance Wars-Shaped Hole in Your Heart with Warside on PS5, PS4

Rolling out!

Warside is a fast-paced 2D tactical strategy game that immediately evokes Nintendo's excellent Advance Wars series or the fantastic Wargroove (not to be confused with the unfortunately-named Wargasm, which is, as we all know, a 3D strategy game). It's planned for launch in 2024 and will be available on both PS5 and PS4. Warside will...

News Management Says Spiders Strike Allegations Are 'False and Even Defamatory'

They "don't reflect the reality" of working for the company

Yesterday, we brought you word of brewing trouble at Greedfall and Steelrising developer, Spiders. Staff have announced a strike, alleging poor working conditions at the Parisian studio. A French union helped broadcast a public letter that was signed by nearly half of the studios' almost...

News Promising Persona-Inspired RPG Demonschool Hit with Hefty Delay

Now targeting 2025

Demonschool is a promising tactical RPG we've had our eye on for a while, and we were eager to get to grips with it imminently on 13th September. Alas, a last-minute delay has been announced by developer Necrosoft Games, with the game given a tentative release window of Q1, 2025. We suppose we'll just have to console ourselves...

News Kratos Actor Chris Judge Claps Back at Amazon Exec's Gaming Dig

Those are fighting words

Legendary Teal'c actor Chris Judge is not known for his restraint. However, in his starring role as God of War's modern Kratos, it seems he's learned how to control the Spartan rage within. When Amazon Games boss Christoph Hartmann made the outrageous allegation that video games "don't really have acting", Judge quickly set...

News Players Complain of Lengthy PS5 Matchmaking Times As Concord Numbers Dwindle

Vicious cycle

In another worrying sign of Concord's ongoing viability, complaints of lengthy matchmaking times have begun to emerge as the already small player base seemingly contracts. After the game's launch weekend, one PS5 player reported waiting up to eight minutes to find a match outside of peak hours, which is obviously not ideal for a...

Sony

News PS5 Fans Who Paid $110 for Star Wars Outlaws Early Access Asked to Restart Saves

In-game trinket as compensation

Increasingly, we’re seeing publishers incentivise their expensive Deluxe and Ultimate Editions with early access. While these bundles generally include additional items, like DLC and cosmetics, many fans buy them because they’re excited to play an upcoming title as soon as possible. That’s certainly the case...

Snitches, scares, and strikes

Sony has today announced the lineup of PS5, PS4 games that PS Plus Essential members can look forward to playing in the month of September 2024. Argonaut Games also returns

Remember Croc: Legend of the Gobbos? It's back! In remaster form! Yes, the cult hit PS1 platformer is officially making its long overdue return with a shiny remaster. Nobody Wants to Die! Red Dead! Civ!

A new type of PS Store sale has gone live as of this morning: Dealmania. It's no different to any other in years past, but it has a new name, and that makes it a bit exciting. As it's asked about Volume 2 of the Master Collection

Thanks to the recent Master Collection that brought back Metal Gear Solid, 2: Sons of Liberty, and 3: Snake Eater to PS5, PS4, the MGS series from Konami is easier to access than ever before. By way of PS5 backwards compatibility, Ground Zeroes and V: The Phant

News Mark Cerny's Feedback on PS5's Astro Bot: 'Now This Is a Game'

No notes

PS5's upcoming platformer Astro Bot is less than two weeks away, and ever since its announcement back in May, it's looked utterly delightful. After having played a portion of it at Summer Game Fest, we can confidently say it is exactly that. Still, it's one thing hearing it from us, and quite another to get feedback from one of the most...

News Incredible Looking Trails in the Sky Remake Is Real, But PS5, PS4 Players Will Have to Wait

Sky high

Classic PSP RPG Trails in the Sky — the first game in Falcom's now renowned Trails saga — is getting a full-on remake. The surprise reveal was part of yesterday's Nintendo Direct, where the project was afforded a bafflingly short amount of time during a montage of upcoming releases. Trails fans were left rubbing their eyes in disbelief...

When it rains, it pours

When will it end for poor embattled developer Bungie? French devs are taking to the streets

Developers at the Paris-based studio Spiders, known for RPG GreedFall and revolutionary Soulslike Steelrising, have announced they will be going on strike in the coming days, starting 2nd September. A committee representing workers at the Nacon-owned studio has published an open letter alleging a litany of...

Harry Potter: Quidditch Champions is right around the corner on PS5 and PS4, and the excitement around the game feels fairly muted. Good news, everyone: Tales of Graces f Remastered won't be following in the very disappointing footsteps of Tales of Symphonia Remastered. News Online RPG Blue Protocol Shutting Down, Western Release Cancelled

Goes offline in Japan on 18th January

Bandai Namco and Amazon Game Studios have announced their collaborative online RPG Blue Protocol will shut down in Japan, and the Western release has been cancelled entirely. Japanese users have until 18th January 2025 to keep on playing the game, at which point it'll be taken offline. In a post on the Blue...

Nanosuits, son

We wouldn't be at all surprised if you've completely forgotten about it, but Crysis 4 was announced in January 2022. Developer Crytek dropped a teaser for the project that barely showed anything, and we've heard nothing about the game since. It's assumed to be in heavy development at this stage. News Japan Hit with Yet Another PS5 Price Increase

PS5 accessories also going up in cost

Sony has confirmed the cost of both PS5 console models will increase once again in Japan, effective from Monday, 2nd September 2024. The standard PS5 with a disc drive will be priced at ¥79,980 (~$550) while the digital version is going up to ¥72,980 (~$500). This represents a ¥13,000 (~$90) price increase...

Black Myth: Wukong turned out to be a real game after all, and it launched on PS5 one whole week ago. Branching out

Down the years, we've seen countless properties attempt to reinvent themselves, either in a bid to reclaim a faded legacy, or to establish a fresh audience. Visions of Mana, however, feels like it's gunning for neither of these goals...
